TopicTitle: UI for fuel tanks in the parts manager is bugged while in flight.

Articles.Content:
Reported Version: v0.1.3 (latest) | Mods: none | Can replicate without mods? Yes 
OS: Windows 10 | CPU: AMD Ryzen 9 5900X 12-Core Processor (24) | GPU: NVIDIA GeForce RTX 2080 | RAM: 32768MB

 

Severity: med

Frequency: high

Description:

When launching any vessel that includes a fuel tank and right-clicking any fuel tank on it, the UI connected to it in the parts manager is completely empty (while in Media regarding the Game I can see it is suppost to be there), not allowing you to view the fuel levels/transfer fuel.

 

Included Attachments:

Edited July 9, 2023 by Anth12
That's because fuel transfer window is elsewhere. Parts manager just have all the parts, even those that aren't interactable.

On 6/25/2023 at 5:15 PM, The Aziz said:

That's because fuel transfer window is elsewhere. Parts manager just have all the parts, even those that aren't interactable.

That is just unintuitive. If I want to monitor the fuel levels in individual tanks then the PAM is the obvious place to look (this is especially useful when working with drop tanks).
